required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of the Safety and Efficacy of a New Treatment for Macular Edema Resulting From Retinal Vein Occlusion

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the safety and efficacy of an intravitreal implant of dexamethasone for the treatment of macular edema associated with retinal vein occlusion.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With 15 or More Letter Improvement in Best Corrected Visual Acuity (BCVA) in the Study Eye
primary_outcome.description: BCVA is measured using an eye chart and is reported as the number of letters read correctly (ranging from 0 to 100 letters). The lower the number of letters read correctly on the eye chart, the worse the vision (or visual acuity). An increase in the number of letters read correctly means that vision has improved. The numbers of patients with at least a 15 or more letter improvement in BCVA in the study eye are presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Retinal Thickness in the Study Eye
secondary_outcome.description: Retinal thickness is assessed by optical coherence tomography (OCT) in the study eye. The retina is the light-sensitive part of the eye. OCT is a laser-based, noninvasive, diagnostic system providing high-resolution, three-dimensional images of the retina. A negative change from baseline indicates an improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With a Change From Baseline in BCVA by Category
secondary_outcome.description: BCVA is measured using an eye chart and is reported as the number of letters read correctly (ranging from 0 to 100 letters). The lower the number of letters read correctly on the eye chart, the worse the vision (or visual acuity). An increase in the number of letters read correctly means that vision has improved. Data are grouped into the following 5 categories based on change from baseline: ≥15 Letters Improvement, ≥5 and <15 Letters Improvement, No Change (Between -5 to +5 Letters), ≥5 and <15 Letters Worsening, and ≥15 Letters Worsening.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With a Change From Baseline in BCVA by Category
secondary_outcome.description: BCVA is measured using an eye chart and is reported as the number of letters read correctly (ranging from 0 to 100 letters). The lower the number of letters read correctly on the eye chart, the worse the vision (or visual acuity). An increase in the number of letters read correctly means that vision has improved. Data are grouped into the following 5 categories based on change from baseline: ≥15 Letters Improvement, ≥5 and <15 Letters Improvement, No Change (Between -5 to +5 Letters), ≥5 and <15 Letters Worsening, and ≥15 Letters Worsening.

arm_group.description: 700 µg dexamethasone intravitreal implant administered on Day 0 and Day 180.

arm_group.arm_group_label: 350 µg Dexamethasone followed by 700 µg Dexamethasone
arm_group.description: 350 µg dexamethasone intravitreal implant administered on Day 0 and 700 µg dexamethasone intravitreal implant on Day 180.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Sham Injection followed by 700 µg Dexamethasone
arm_group.description: Sham injection on Day 0 and 700 µg dexamethasone intravitreal implant on Day 180.

intervention.description: 700 µg dexamethasone intravitreal implant administered on Day 0 and/or Day 180.
intervention.arm_group_label: 350 µg Dexamethasone followed by 700 µg Dexamethasone
Sham Injection followed by 700 µg Dexamethasone

intervention.description: 350 µg Dexamethasone intravitreal implant administered on Day 0.
intervention.arm_group_label: 350 µg Dexamethasone followed by 700 µg Dexamethasone
Sham Injection followed by 700 µg Dexamethasone

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 years of age or older with macular edema resulting from retinal vein occlusion
- Decrease in visual acuity in at least one eye as a result of macular edema (20/50 or worse)
- Visual acuity in other eye no worse than 20/200
Key Exclusion Criteria:
- Known anticipated need for ocular surgery within next 12 months
- History of glaucoma or current high eye pressure requiring more than 1 medication
- Diabetic retinopathy
- Uncontrolled systemic disease
- Known steroid-responder
- Use of systemic steroids
- Use of warfarin/heparin

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Patients were randomly assigned during the double-blind period of the study to treatment with 700 µg dexamethasone, 350 µg dexamethasone, or sham injection on Day 0. Patients who qualified to continue in the open-label period of the study received 700 µg dexamethasone on Day 180.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) are reported for the double-blind treatment period through Month 6.
reported_events.desc: The safety population included all randomized patients who received at least one dose of study medication and was used to assess AEs and SAEs.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: A disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 90 days from the time submitted to the sponsor for review. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
